node.title: Russia rejects accusations it endangered astronauts with missile test
node.description: Russia says it did conduct a weapons test targeting an old satellite but rejects US claims its actions put the lives of astronauts at risk.
node.content: ["Russia has confirmed it conducted a weapons test targeting an old satellite, but\u00a0rejected accusations from the US that it endangered astronauts aboard the International Space Station.", "The accusation came from US officials on Monday when they said the destruction of the satellite\u00a0created more than 1,500 pieces of space junk, in what they called a reckless and irresponsible strike.", "NASA administrator Bill Nelson said Russia's actions were \"unthinkable\"\u00a0amid fears the\u00a0debris could do major damage to the space station, as it is orbiting at 28,000 kph.", "The incident led the four Americans, one German and two Russians on board the International Space Station (ISS)\u00a0to seek shelter in their docked capsules, which can operate as lifeboats.", "They spent two hours in the two capsules, finally emerging only to have to close and reopen hatches to the station's individual labs on every orbit, or one and a half\u00a0hours, as they passed near or through the debris.", "US\u00a0Secretary of State Antony Blinken condemned Russia for the test in a statement.", "\"Russia, despite its claims of opposing the weaponisation of outer space, is willing to jeopardise the long-term sustainability of outer space and imperil the exploration and use of outer space by all nations through its reckless and irresponsible behaviour,\" Mr Blinken said.", "Russia's\u00a0Defence Ministry denied the claim, saying: \"The US\u00a0knows for certain that the resulting fragments, in terms of test time and orbital parameters, did not and will not pose a threat to orbital stations, spacecraft and space activities\"\u00a0and called remarks by US\u00a0officials \"hypocritical\" given past incidents.", "Anti-satellite missile tests by the US\u00a0in 2008 and India in 2019 were conducted at much lower altitudes, well below the ISS at about 420 kilometres.", "A similar weapons test by China in 2007 also resulted in countless pieces of debris. One of those threatened to come dangerously close to the space station last week.", "While it later was dismissed as a risk, NASA had the station move anyway.", "ABC/wires"]
